Title: Join attributes by location
Abstract:
This algorithm takes an input vector layer and creates a new vector layer that is an extended version of the input one, with additional attributes in its attribute table.
The additional attributes and their values are taken from a second vector layer. A spatial criteria is applied to select the values from the second layer that are added to each feature from the first layer in the resulting one.
The algorithm calculates a statistical summary for the values from matching features in the second layer (e.g. maximum value, mean value, etc).

Accepted data types.str: as string representation of int, e.g. '1'

Input.Abstract: Fields to summarise (leave empty to use all fields)
Summaries to calculate (leave empty to use all available)

Accepted data types.str: as string representation of int, e.g. '1'

Input.Abstract: Discard records which could not be joined

Accepted data types.str: 'memory:' to store result in temporary memory layer
using vector provider ID prefix and destination URI, e.g. 'postgres:…' to store result in PostGIS table
